page.title: 13A WALK IN S.E SHROPSHIRE.
page.content: Ordnance Survey 1:25,000 Pathfinder maps (sheets SO 68/78, SO 67/77) give entree to walks on footpaths and to picturesque villages, views of rolling hills, valleys and colourful fields and hedgerows. Students with hammers regularly visit the sandstone outcrops on Farlow Bank. Research is currently under way on the deserted village site of Denton. The disused bed of the Ditton Light railway winds through a delightful route. Streams here feed the Severn near the village of Highley. Parish churches, manor and farm houses, farm animals and machinery, wild animals and plants add to the interest of the walk.
